results.title: Things to come
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions, Alexander Korda and William Cameron Menzies
results.brief_description: Things to come is the famous film adaptation of H.G. Wells’ prophetic novel and futuristic exploration ‘The Shape of Things to Come’. Wells’ futuristic vision of impending global war (chillingly) begins at the outbreak of World War II in 1940. The film shifts to the mid 1960’s to Everytown, a place in ruins ruled by a makeshift warlord on the brink of insanity. The film’s closing act begins in 2036 Everytown, at a time of peace but also uninspiring technological Utopia. Run by scientists the townsfolk eventually resist the directives of the scientists and rebel against their imposed staid futuristic lifestyles. With extraordinary set designs by Vincent Korda. Cast includes Raymond Massey and Ralph Richardson.

results.title: Things change
results.creator_credit: Filmhaus Productions, Columbia Pictures, Michael Hausman and David Mamet
results.brief_description: Don Ameche plays Gino, a veteran shoeshine who makes a deal with the Mafia to take the rap for a slaying, while Joe Mantegna plays Jerry, a Mafia hood assigned to supervise Gino before his court appearance. Ignoring orders, Jerry takes his charge to the gambling resort at Lake Tahoe for his last weekend of freedom where the old man is mistaken for a major figure in organised crime. Through the complications that result, the two men forge a trusting and compassionate friendship in complimentary roles that earned them a combined Best Actor Award at the Venice Film Festival. Screenplay by David Mamet and Shel Silverstein.

results.title: Things afoot
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Roy A. Driver
results.brief_description: Envisages a world without shoes to prove how footwear is indispensable in modern everyday life. A visit to a shoe factory illustrates the many complicated machines used in the manufacture of footwear. Scenes at a technical school show how the young apprentice receives theoretical and practical training in the manufacture of shoes. The concluding section of the film lists the advantages of employment in the shoe trade; stability of employment, welfare schemes, recreational facilities, wages etc.

results.title: Thin end of the wedge (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A program that looks at a week in the life of a young wood craftsman, Barry Mills. He struggles to make a living from his work, rejecting the temptation to produce what a businessman wants rather than what he wants to do. He seeks advice from an experienced country wood worker and finally exhibits his work.

results.title: Thieves like us
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Jerry Bick and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Keith Carradine is cast as Bowie, one of three criminals who escape from prison and after a period of good behaviour, fall back into crime by committing a series of bank robberies. In typical ‘Bonnie and Clyde’ (303821) fashion, Bowie falls in love with Keechie (Shelley Duvall), the daughter of the farmer who helped them escape, and she too joins them in their escapades. Bowie and Keechie plan to escape to Mexico, but their dreams for a new start are doomed by the behaviour of the other two criminals, and the couple are destined for tragedy. This remake of the ‘They live by night’ (1948), is based on the novel by Edward Anderson. Cast includes Keith Carradine, Shelley Duvall, John Schuck, Bert Remsen and Louise Fletcher.

results.title: Thieves = Les Voleurs
results.creator_credit: Les Films Alain Sarde, TF1 Films productions, Rhone-Alpes Cinema, D.A. Films, Alain Sarde and Andre Techine
results.brief_description: One of France’s most significant and prolific Post-New Wave directors, Andre Techine’s films are characterised by their exploration of the complexities of emotion and human relationships. He has collaborated with some of France’s most respected actresses, including Catherine Deneuve, Juliette Binoche, Jeanne Moreau, and Isabelle Adjani. In ‘Les Voleurs’, his fifth film with Deneuve, Techine takes the crime genre and uses it as the framework by which to explore a three-way relationship that deals in abuse, exploitation and suicidal despair- in short, the very darkest aspects of emotional relationships. Alex (Daniel Auteuil) is a sexually-brutal cop who comes from a ruthless family of criminals. Marie (Deneuve), is a middle-aged professor who falls, first with astonishment, and then despairingly, for Juliette (Laurence Cote), a young women on the wrong side of the law who has been having sexual liaisons with Alex. A perilous sexual triangle ensues, with Juliette a pawn in a game that has the highest stakes. In French with English subtitles.

A discussion starter for unemployment, the nuclear debate, adolescence and society, and fears of the future.

results.title: Thief of hearts
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Douglas Stewart
results.brief_description: Ray (John Getz) and Mickey (Barbara Williams) Davis were the perfect married couple, or so everyone thought. Bored with her workaholic and disinterested husband, Mickey turns to her diary as an outlet, writing down her innermost sexual fantasies and desires. This is until the Davis’ home is burgled and the robber takes off with not only an assortment of valuables, but also Mickey’s secret diary. The thief, Scott Muller (Steven Bauer), soon finds himself obsessed with Mickey after reading her diary and plots and plans his way into meeting and seducing her. Mickey and Ray’s life is turned inside out whilst Muller’s obsession almost destroys him. Erotic thriller of the 80s with 80s soundtrack featuring Giorgio Moroder and Melissa Manchester. Includes a cameo role by a very young David Caruso (of NYPD Blues TV series fame) and support cast including George Wendt and Christine Ebersole.

results.title: They were expendable
results.brief_description: Robert Montgomery and John Wayne are naval lieutenants stationed in the Philippines who are keen to test their squadrons and equipment in battle. They get the chance to do so when the Japanese attack Pearl Harbour and the US enters World War II. Donna Reed also features as a nurse falling in love with Wayne, but the relationship takes second place to the brilliant staging and editing of the navy and air battles. In the bloody and intense war scenes Ford shows his brilliance as a film director. Based on the novel of the same name by William L. White.
